articles.headline: N.S.A. Contractor Arrested in Possible New Theft of Secrets
articles.snippet: The F.B.I. is investigating whether Harold T. Martin III, a National Security Agency contractor, stole and disclosed highly classified computer code, officials said.
articles.abstract: The F.B.I. is investigating whether Harold T. Martin III, a National Security Agency contractor, stole and disclosed highly classified computer code, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. secretly arrested a former National Security Agency contractor in August and, according to law enforcement officials, is investigating whether he stole and disclosed highly classified computer code developed by the agency to hack into the networks of foreign governments.
articles.byline: By Jo Becker, Adam Goldman, Michael S. Schmidt and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: What Is a ‘Personal Benefit’ From Insider Trading? Justices Hear Arguments
articles.snippet: The issue turns on whether friendship or family relationship amounts to a benefit comparable to money that would make providing an insider tip illegal.
articles.abstract: The issue turns on whether friendship or family relationship amounts to a benefit comparable to money that would make providing an insider tip illegal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Supreme Court justices offered hope to both prosecutors and traders on Wednesday during arguments in the first insider trading case to come before the nation’s high court in two decades.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Yahoo Said to Have Aided U.S. Email Surveillance by Adapting Spam Filter
articles.snippet: A system built to scan emails for spam, child pornography and malware allowed Yahoo to search for a terrorist organization’s “signature” to satisfy a secret court order, several sources say.
articles.abstract: A system built to scan emails for spam, child pornography and malware allowed Yahoo to search for a terrorist organization’s “signature” to satisfy a secret court order, several sources say.
articles.lead_paragraph: A system intended to scan emails for child pornography and spam helped Yahoo satisfy a secret court order requiring it to search for messages containing a computer “signature” tied to the communications of a state-sponsored terrorist organization, several people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: United States Criticizes Israel Over West Bank Settlement Plan
articles.snippet: The Obama administration said the move violated the pledge by Israel not to construct new Jewish settlements and ran counter to its long-term security interests.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration said the move violated the pledge by Israel not to construct new Jewish settlements and ran counter to its long-term security interests.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration on Wednesday castigated the Israeli government for approving plans to create a new Jewish settlement on the West Bank, three weeks after it signed a lucrative military aid package with the United States and just as President Obama was traveling to Jerusalem for the funeral of Shimon Peres.

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Slip in Polls Has G.O.P. Worried About Congress
articles.snippet: With Mr. Trump’s support plunging in swing states, Republican congressional candidates are faced with openly fleeing the nominee to save their own campaigns.
articles.abstract: With Mr. Trump’s support plunging in swing states, Republican congressional candidates are faced with openly fleeing the nominee to save their own campaigns.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s support has plunged across the swing-state map over the last 10 days, wiping out his political recovery from September and threatening to undo weeks of Republican gains in the battle for control of Congress.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Oil Glut? Here Comes Some More!
articles.snippet: Oil finds in Texas and Alaska come at a time when the industry is struggling with low prices and faces pressure to leave hydrocarbons in the ground.
articles.abstract: Oil finds in Texas and Alaska come at a time when the industry is struggling with low prices and faces pressure to leave hydrocarbons in the ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Global oil markets are flooded with cheap crude, and concerns about climate change are growing louder. The last thing the world seems to be craving is the discovery of new large oil and natural gas fields.

articles.headline: Twitter’s Fate: Marc Benioff of Salesforce Addresses Acquisition Talk
articles.snippet: The tech world has been buzzing since it heard that the online software company Salesforce was interested in bidding for Twitter.
articles.abstract: The tech world has been buzzing since it heard that the online software company Salesforce was interested in bidding for Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Marc Benioff, the founder and chief executive of Salesforce.com, showed up onstage on Wednesday afternoon at his biggest customer event of the year to talk up his business technology company’s products and strategy.

articles.headline: As Drug Deaths Soar, a Silver Lining for Transplant Patients
articles.snippet: Drug users are the fastest-growing category of organ donor, and now rank fourth behind victims of stroke, blunt trauma and heart disease.
articles.abstract: Drug users are the fastest-growing category of organ donor, and now rank fourth behind victims of stroke, blunt trauma and heart disease.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The surge in deaths from drug overdoses has become an unexpected lifeline for people waiting for organ transplants, turning tragedy for some into salvation for others.

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Ventures Began With a Lot of Hype. Here’s How They Turned Out.
articles.snippet: Of roughly 60 ventures started or promoted by Mr. Trump, a third did not work out, a third had some success and some problems, and a third met expectations.
articles.abstract: Of roughly 60 ventures started or promoted by Mr. Trump, a third did not work out, a third had some success and some problems, and a third met expectations.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump unveiled his new online travel booking venture, GoTrump.com, he said in a promotional video in 2006 that customers would “love everything I put on this site.” “There’s nobody better,” he added. “There’s nobody even close!”
articles.byline: By Steve Eder and Alicia Parlapiano

articles.headline: Deutsche Bank as Next Lehman Brothers: Far-Fetched but Not Unthinkable
articles.snippet: Global markets have roiled recently over fears that Deutsche Bank will not be able to absorb a $14 billion fine from the Justice Department.
articles.abstract: Global markets have roiled recently over fears that Deutsche Bank will not be able to absorb a $14 billion fine from the Justice Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: All it took was the threat of a $14 billion fine against Deutsche Bank for the word “contagion” to rear its ugly head.
